chapter.title: OpenStack
chapter.para:
The openstack client is a common OpenStack command-line interface (CLI).
This chapter documents openstack version 1.6.0.
For help on a specific openstack command, enter:

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack [--version] [-v] [--log-file LOG_FILE] [-q] [-h] [--debug] [--os-cloud <cloud-config-name>] [--os-region-name <auth-region-name>] [--os-cacert <ca-bundle-file>] [--verify | --insecure] [--os-default-domain <auth-domain>] [--os-interface <interface>] [--timing] [--os-compute-api-version <compute-api-version>] [--os-network-api-version <network-api-version>] [--os-image-api-version <image-api-version>] [--os-volume-api-version <volume-api-version>] [--os-identity-api-version <identity-api-version>] [--os-auth-type <auth-type>] [--os-username <auth-username>] [--os-identity-provider <auth-identity-provider>] [--os-project-domain-name <auth-project-domain-name>] [--os-project-domain-id <auth-project-domain-id>] [--os-project-name <auth-project-name>] [--os-auth-url <auth-auth-url>] [--os-trust-id <auth-trust-id>] [--os-service-provider-endpoint <auth-service-provider-endpoint>] [--os-user-domain-id <auth-user-domain-id>] [--os-domain-name <auth-domain-name>] [--os-identity-provider-url <auth-identity-provider-url>] [--os-token <auth-token>] [--os-domain-id <auth-domain-id>] [--os-url <auth-url>] [--os-user-domain-name <auth-user-domain-name>] [--os-user-id <auth-user-id>] [--os-password <auth-password>] [--os-endpoint <auth-endpoint>] [--os-project-id <auth-project-id>] [--os-object-api-version <object-api-version>]

listitem.para: show program's version number and exit
Increase verbosity of output. Can be repeated.
Specify a file to log output. Disabled by default.
suppress output except warnings and errors
show this help message and exit
show tracebacks on errors
Cloud name in clouds.yaml (Env: OS_CLOUD)
Authentication region name (Env: OS_REGION_NAME)
CA certificate bundle file (Env: OS_CACERT)
Verify server certificate (default)
Disable server certificate verification
Default domain ID, default=default (Env: OS_DEFAULT_DOMAIN)
Select an interface type. Valid interface types: [admin, public, internal]. (Env: OS_INTERFACE)
Print API call timing info
Compute API version, default=2 (Env: OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION)
Network API version, default=2 (Env: OS_NETWORK_API_VERSION)
Image API version, default=1 (Env: OS_IMAGE_API_VERSION)
Volume API version, default=1 (Env: OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION)
Identity API version, default=2 (Env: OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION)

Select an auhentication type. Available types: v2token, v2password, v3password, v3scopedsaml, v3unscopedadfs, token, v3token, password, v3unscopedsaml, osc_password, token_endpoint. Default: selected based on --os-username/--os-token (Env: OS_AUTH_TYPE)
With v2password: Username to login with With v3password: Username With v3unscopedadfs: Username With password: Username With v3unscopedsaml: Username With osc_password: Username (Env: OS_USERNAME)
With v3unscopedadfs: Identity Provider's name With v3unscopedsaml: Identity Provider's name (Env: OS_IDENTITY_PROVIDER)

With v3password: Domain name containing project With v3scopedsaml: Domain name containing project With v3unscopedadfs: Domain name containing project With token: Domain name containing project With v3token: Domain name containing project With password: Domain name containing project With v3unscopedsaml: Domain name containing project With osc_password: Domain name containing project (Env: OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME)

With v3password: Domain ID containing project With v3scopedsaml: Domain ID containing project With v3unscopedadfs: Domain ID containing project With token: Domain ID containing project With v3token: Domain ID containing project With password: Domain ID containing project With v3unscopedsaml: Domain ID containing project With osc_password: Domain ID containing project (Env: OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_ID)

With v3password: Project name to scope to With v3scopedsaml: Project name to scope to With v3unscopedadfs: Project name to scope to With token: Project name to scope to With v3token: Project name to scope to With password: Project name to scope to With v3unscopedsaml: Project name to scope to With osc_password: Project name to scope to (Env: OS_PROJECT_NAME)

With v2token: Authentication URL With v2password: Authentication URL With v3password: Authentication URL With v3scopedsaml: Authentication URL With v3unscopedadfs: Authentication URL With token: Authentication URL With v3token: Authentication URL With password: Authentication URL With v3unscopedsaml: Authentication URL With osc_password: Authentication URL (Env: OS_AUTH_URL)

With v2token: Trust ID With v2password: Trust ID With v3password: Trust ID With v3scopedsaml: Trust ID With v3unscopedadfs: Trust ID With token: Trust ID With v3token: Trust ID With password: Trust ID With v3unscopedsaml: Trust ID With osc_password: Trust ID (Env: OS_TRUST_ID)
With v3unscopedadfs: Service Provider's Endpoint (Env: OS_SERVICE_PROVIDER_ENDPOINT)
With v3password: User's domain id With password: User's domain id With osc_password: User's domain id (Env: OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID)

With v3password: Domain name to scope to With v3scopedsaml: Domain name to scope to With v3unscopedadfs: Domain name to scope to With token: Domain name to scope to With v3token: Domain name to scope to With password: Domain name to scope to With v3unscopedsaml: Domain name to scope to With osc_password: Domain name to scope to (Env: OS_DOMAIN_NAME)
With v3unscopedadfs: Identity Provider's URL With v3unscopedsaml: Identity Provider's URL (Env: OS_IDENTITY_PROVIDER_URL)

With v2token: Token With v3scopedsaml: Token to authenticate with With token: Token to authenticate with With v3token: Token to authenticate with With token_endpoint: The token that will always be used With token_endpoint: Authentication token to use (Env: OS_TOKEN)

With v3password: Domain ID to scope to With v3scopedsaml: Domain ID to scope to With v3unscopedadfs: Domain ID to scope to With token: Domain ID to scope to With v3token: Domain ID to scope to With password: Domain ID to scope to With v3unscopedsaml: Domain ID to scope to With osc_password: Domain ID to scope to (Env: OS_DOMAIN_ID)
With token_endpoint: Specific service endpoint to use (Env: OS_URL)
With v3password: User's domain name With password: User's domain name With osc_password: User's domain name (Env: OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME)
With v2password: User ID to login with With v3password: User ID With password: User id With osc_password: User id (Env: OS_USER_ID)

With v2password: Password to use With v3password: User's password With v3unscopedadfs: Password With password: User's password With v3unscopedsaml: Password With osc_password: User's password (Env: OS_PASSWORD)
With token_endpoint: The endpoint that will always be used (Env: OS_ENDPOINT)

With v3password: Project ID to scope to With v3scopedsaml: Project ID to scope to With v3unscopedadfs: Project ID to scope to With token: Project ID to scope to With v3token: Project ID to scope to With password: Project ID to scope to With v3unscopedsaml: Project ID to scope to With osc_password: Project ID to scope to (Env: OS_PROJECT_ID)
Object API version, default=1 (Env: OS_OBJECT_API_VERSION)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token aggregate add host [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <aggregate> <host>

listitem.para: Aggregate (name or ID)
Host to add to <aggregate>
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token aggregate create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--zone <availability-zone>] [--property <key=value>] <name>

listitem.para: New aggregate name
show this help message and exit
Availability zone name
Property to add to this aggregate (repeat option to set multiple properties)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token aggregate delete [-h] <aggregate>

listitem.para: Aggregate to delete (name or ID)
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token aggregate list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--long]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
List additional fields in output

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token aggregate remove host [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <aggregate> <host>

listitem.para: Aggregate (name or ID)
Host to remove from <aggregate>
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token aggregate set [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--name <name>] [--zone <availability-zone>] [--property <key=value>] <aggregate>

listitem.para: Aggregate to modify (name or ID)
show this help message and exit
Set aggregate name
Set availability zone name
Property to set on <aggregate> (repeat option to set multiple properties)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token aggregate show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <aggregate>

listitem.para: Aggregate to display (name or ID)
show this help message and exit

section.title: openstack availability zone list

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token availability zone list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--long]

section.para: List availability zones and their status

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
List additional fields in output

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token backup create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--container <container>] [--name <name>] [--description <description>] <volume>

listitem.para: Volume to backup (name or ID)
show this help message and exit
Optional backup container name
Name of the backup
Description of the backup

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token backup delete [-h] <backup> [<backup> ...]

listitem.para: Backup(s) to delete (ID only)
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token backup list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--long]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
List additional fields in output

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token backup restore [-h] <backup> <volume>

listitem.para: Backup to restore (ID only)
Volume to restore to (name or ID)
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token backup show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <backup>

listitem.para: Backup to display (ID only)
show this help message and exit

section.title: openstack catalog list

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token catalog list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}]

section.para: List services in the service catalog

listitem.para: show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token catalog show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <service>

listitem.para: Service to display (type or name)
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token command list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token compute agent create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <os> <architecture> <version> <url> <md5hash> <hypervisor>

listitem.para: Type of OS
Type of architecture
Version
URL
MD5 hash
Type of hypervisor
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token compute agent delete [-h] <id>

listitem.para: ID of agent to delete
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token compute agent list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--hypervisor <hypervisor>]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
Type of hypervisor

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token compute agent set [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <id> <version> <url> <md5hash>

listitem.para: ID of the agent
Version of the agent
URL
MD5 hash
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token compute service list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--host <host>] [--service <service>]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
Name of host
Name of service

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token compute service set [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--enable | --disable] <host> <service>

listitem.para: Name of host
Name of service
show this help message and exit
Enable a service
Disable a service

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token configuration show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--mask | --unmask]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
Attempt to mask passwords (default)
Show password in clear text

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token console log show [-h] [--lines <num-lines>] <server>

listitem.para: Server to show console log (name or ID)
show this help message and exit
Number of lines to display from the end of the log (default=all)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token console url show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--novnc | --xvpvnc | --spice] <server>

listitem.para: Server to show URL (name or ID)
show this help message and exit
Show noVNC console URL (default)
Show xpvnc console URL
Show SPICE console URL

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token container create [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] <container-name> [<container-name> ...]

listitem.para: New container name(s)
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token container delete [-h] <container> [<container> ...]

listitem.para: Container(s) to delete
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token container list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--prefix <prefix>] [--marker <marker>] [--end-marker <end-marker>] [--limit <limit>] [--long] [--all]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
Filter list using <prefix>
Anchor for paging
End anchor for paging
Limit the number of containers returned
List additional fields in output
List all containers (default is 10000)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token container save [-h] <container>

listitem.para: Container to save
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token container show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <container>

listitem.para: Container to display
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token ec2 credentials create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--project <project>] [--user <user>]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
Create credentials in project (name or ID; default: current authenticated project)
Create credentials for user (name or ID; default: current authenticated user)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token ec2 credentials delete [-h] [--user <user>] <access-key>

listitem.para: Credentials access key
show this help message and exit
Delete credentials for user (name or ID)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token ec2 credentials list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--user <user>]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
Filter list by user (name or ID)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token ec2 credentials show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--user <user>] <access-key>

listitem.para: Credentials access key
show this help message and exit
Show credentials for user (name or ID)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token endpoint create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] --publicurl <url> [--adminurl <url>] [--internalurl <url>] [--region <region-id>] <service>

listitem.para: New endpoint service (name or ID)
show this help message and exit
New endpoint public URL (required)
New endpoint admin URL
New endpoint internal URL
New endpoint region ID

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token endpoint delete [-h] <endpoint-id>

listitem.para: Endpoint ID to delete
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token endpoint list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--long]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
List additional fields in output

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token endpoint show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <endpoint-id>

listitem.para: Endpoint ID to display
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token extension list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--compute] [--identity] [--network] [--volume] [--long]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
List extensions for the Compute API
List extensions for the Identity API
List extensions for the Network API
List extensions for the Volume API
List additional fields in output

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token flavor create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--id <id>] [--ram <size-mb>] [--disk <size-gb>] [--ephemeral <size-gb>] [--swap <size-gb>] [--vcpus <vcpus>] [--rxtx-factor <factor>] [--public | --private] <flavor-name>

listitem.para: New flavor name
show this help message and exit
Unique flavor ID; 'auto' creates a UUID (default: auto)
Memory size in MB (default 256M)
Disk size in GB (default 0G)
Ephemeral disk size in GB (default 0G)
Swap space size in GB (default 0G)
Number of vcpus (default 1)
RX/TX factor (default 1)
Flavor is available to other projects (default)
Flavor is not available to other projects

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token flavor delete [-h] <flavor>

listitem.para: Flavor to delete (name or ID)
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token flavor list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--public | --private | --all] [--long]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
List only public flavors (default)
List only private flavors
List all flavors, whether public or private
List additional fields in output

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token flavor set [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--property <key=value>] <flavor>

listitem.para: Flavor to modify (name or ID)
show this help message and exit
Property to add or modify for this flavor (repeat option to set multiple properties)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token flavor show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <flavor>

listitem.para: Flavor to display (name or ID)
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token flavor unset [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] --property <key> <flavor>

listitem.para: Flavor to modify (name or ID)
show this help message and exit
Property to remove from flavor (repeat option to unset multiple properties)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token host list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--zone <zone>]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
Only return hosts in the availability zone.

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token host show [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] <host>

listitem.para: Name of host
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token hypervisor list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--matching <hostname>]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
Filter hypervisors using <hostname> substring

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token hypervisor show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] <hypervisor>

listitem.para: Hypervisor to display (name or ID)
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token hypervisor stats show [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token image create [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--id <id>] [--store <store>] [--container-format <container-format>] [--disk-format <disk-format>] [--owner <project>] [--size <size>] [--min-disk <disk-gb>] [--min-ram <ram-mb>] [--location <image-url>] [--copy-from <image-url>] [--file <file>] [--volume <volume>] [--force] [--checksum <checksum>] [--protected | --unprotected] [--public | --private] [--property <key=value>] <image-name>

listitem.para: New image name
show this help message and exit
Image ID to reserve
Upload image to this store
Image container format (default: bare)
Image disk format (default: raw)
Image owner project name or ID
Image size, in bytes (only used with --location and --copy-from)
Minimum disk size needed to boot image, in gigabytes
Minimum RAM size needed to boot image, in megabytes
Download image from an existing URL
Copy image from the data store (similar to --location)
Upload image from local file
Create image from a volume
Force image creation if volume is in use (only meaningful with --volume)
Image hash used for verification
Prevent image from being deleted
Allow image to be deleted (default)
Image is accessible to the public
Image is inaccessible to the public (default)
Set a property on this image (repeat option to set multiple properties)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token image delete [-h] <image> [<image> ...]

listitem.para: Image(s) to delete (name or ID)
show this help message and exit

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token image list [-h] [-f {csv,html,json,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--quote {all,minimal,none,nonnumeric}] [--public | --private] [--property <key=value>] [--long] [--sort <key>[:<direction>]]

listitem.para: show this help message and exit
List only public images
List only private images
Filter output based on property
List additional fields in output
Sort output by selected keys and directions(asc or desc) (default: asc), multiple keys and directions can be specified separated by comma

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token image save [-h] [--file <filename>] <image>

listitem.para: Image to save (name or ID)
show this help message and exit
Downloaded image save filename (default: stdout)

screen.computeroutput: usage: openstack --os-auth-type token image set [-h] [-f {html,json,shell,table,value,yaml}] [-c COLUMN] [--max-width <integer>] [--prefix PREFIX] [--name <name>] [--owner <project>] [--min-disk <disk-gb>] [--min-ram <disk-ram>] [--container-format <container-format>] [--disk-format <disk-format>] [--size <size>] [--protected | --unprotected] [--public | --private] [--property <key=value>] [--store <store>] [--location <image-url>] [--copy-from <image-url>] [--file <file>] [--volume <volume>] [--force] [--stdin] [--checksum <checksum>] <image>

listitem.para: Image to modify (name or ID)
show this help message and exit
New image name
New image owner project (name or ID)
Minimum disk size needed to boot image, in gigabytes
Minimum RAM size needed to boot image, in megabytes
Container format of image. Acceptable formats: ['ami', 'ari', 'aki', 'bare', 'ovf']
Disk format of image. Acceptable formats: ['ami', 'ari', 'aki', 'vhd', 'vmdk', 'raw', 'qcow2', 'vdi', 'iso']
Size of image data (in bytes)
Prevent image from being deleted
Allow image to be deleted (default)
Image is accessible to the public
Image is inaccessible to the public (default)
Set a property on this image (repeat option to set multiple properties)
Upload image to this store
Download image from an existing URL
Copy image from the data store (similar to --location)
Upload image from local file
Create image from a volume
Force image change if volume is in use (only meaningful with --volume)

Create server from this image

User data file to serve from the metadata server
Select an availability zone for the server
Map block devices; map is <id>:<type>:<size(GB)>:<delete_on_terminate> (optional extension)

Create a NIC on the server. Specify option multiple times to create multiple NICs. Either net-id or port- id must be provided, but not both. net-id: attach NIC to network with this UUID, port-id: attach NIC to port with this UUID, v4-fixed-ip: IPv4 fixed address for NIC (optional), v6-fixed-ip: IPv6 fixed address for NIC (optional).
Hints for the scheduler (optional extension)
Use specified volume as the config drive, or 'True' to use an ephemeral drive
Minimum number of servers to launch (default=1)

Wait for build to complete
